attributes.action: Reverse the decision to ban Dutch member of Parliament Geer Van Wilders from traveling to the UK
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
On 10 February 2009 the British Government  banned Dutch MP Geert van Wilders from traveling to the UK in the following terms:

"The Secretary of State is satisfied  that your statements about Muslims and their beliefs, as expressed in  your film Fitna and elsewhere, would threaten community harmony and therefore public security in the UK"

This represents a dramatic  curtailing of the right of free speech and a pandering to religious intolerance that despises our democratic values. 

Geer van Wilders expresses genuine concerns about the rise of militant Islam in Europe and to ban him from the UK on the grounds of protecting "community harmony" is a victory for religious intolerance and violence over democracy.

Banning van Wilders from traveling to the UK for  is a national disgrace and marks an abuse of the democratic system:  we call on the Prime Minister to reverse the decision immediately.

rejection.details: Individual legal cases are a matter for direct communication with the Home Office.
